alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 23 at 1:36PM PST until December 25 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 4000 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible with total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches possible. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers are expected to diminish in intensity this afternoon into tonight for the Oregon Cascades before another round of heavy snow arrives Friday morning. The heaviest snow will be for the Cascade passes where totals of 12 to 18 inches are forecast. Lower elevations will see lighter amounts in the 4 to 6 inch range.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
